param.name: FloodingInput
param.dialogReference: The layer that represents the flooding areas.

param.name: NoFloodingValue
param.dialogReference: The value that represent where no flooding occurs. Typically this is NoData, or 0.

param.name: BaselineElevation
param.dialogReference:
Flooding values typically represent flood depth values. To be able to visualize this in 3D, we need to calculate flood elevation values relative to a known vertical coordinate system (VCS).

The Baseline Elevation raster represents the elevation surface that will be used to calculate elevation flood values. The flooding values will be added to the elevation surface to create a flood elevation surface.

Note:This parameter is optional. Only needed if the flooding values do NOT represent elevation values i.e. they represent depth values.

param.name: BaselineElevationValue
param.dialogReference:
Enter the elevation value represents the elevation value that will be used to calculate elevation flood values.

  • Use this parameter if no Baseline Elevation raster is available.

  • Set to 0 if the flooding values represent flood elevation values.

  • If a Baseline Elevation raster is selected, this value will be ignored.

For example:

Simple scenario: flood value of 3 feet and base elevation of 100 feet results in a flood elevation level of 103 feet relative to the chosen VCS.

For example:

Sea Level Rise (SLR) flooding data: flooding values typically represent flood elevation values referenced to a local tidal datum. However to accurately visualize SLR levels in a 3D scene, the values needs to be referenced to the orthometric datum used by the scene (fore example: NAVD88) . In this case, the Baseline Elevation Value represents the relative difference between the local tidal elevation and the orthometric elevation for the area of interest.

Looking at 3 Foot Sea Level Rise for Baltimore produced by NOAA. This SLR data has 0 for non flooded areas and 1 for flooded areas and the elevation baseline for the SLR data was Mean Sea Level.

Using NOAA's Tidal and Orthometric Elevation tool, we can see that for Baltimore, the difference between Mean Sea Level (0.80 feet) and NAV88D (0.83 feet) is 0.03 feet. The Baseline Elevation Value for Baltimore therefore would be 0.03 and this value gets added to the flood elevation values. 3 foot SLR becomes 3.03 foot SLR etc.

The No Flooding Value is: 0. The Flood Value is: 3. The Baseline Elevation Value is: 0.03

param.name: FloodValue
param.dialogReference: If the input raster values do NOT represent flood elevation value, this value will be used as elevation values for the flooded areas.

param.name: Output Features
param.dialogReference: Enter a name for the output 3D flood level feature class
